workflow.name: Business Model Canvas AI-Powered Generator (LLM Flexible)
workflow.description:
### üë• Who is this for?

- Startup founders validating or pitching new ideas  
- Business consultants running strategy sessions  
- Product teams defining business logic visually  
- Agencies offering planning frameworks to clients  

---

### ‚ùì What problem does this workflow solve?

Creating a Business Model Canvas manually is time-consuming and often scattered across tools. This workflow solves that by allowing users to generate a **fully populated, formatted, and printable Business Model Canvas** in seconds using the power of AI, all structured in a professional A4 landscape layout.

---

### ‚öôÔ∏è What this workflow does

- Starts with a **chat input** asking for your business idea  
- Sends it to **9 separate AI agents**, each focused on one section:
  - Key Partners  
  - Key Activities  
  - Value Proposition  
  - Customer Relationships  
  - Customer Segments  
  - Key Resources  
  - Channels  
  - Cost Structure  
  - Revenue Streams  
- Uses your preferred LLM (see below) to generate meaningful bullet points  
- Converts output into a specific format  
- Merges all sections into a clean, A4-styled HTML canvas  
- Exports the result as a downloadable `.html` file

---

### üõ†Ô∏è Setup

1. Import the workflow into your n8n instance  
2. Start the flow from the **‚ÄúWhen chat message received‚Äù** node  
3. Describe your business idea when prompted (e.g., ‚ÄúOnline bookshop with rare Persian literature‚Äù)  
4. Wait for AI processing to complete  
5. Visit the last node **‚ÄúHTML code to HTML file‚Äù**  
6. Click **Download** to get your final canvas in `.html` format  

---

### ü§ñ LLM Flexibility (Choose Your Model)

This template supports any AI model with a chat interface:

- Ollama (self-hosted models like LLaMA, etc.)  
- OpenAI (GPT-4, GPT-3.5)  
- Anything with a compatible node

You can easily change the LLM by updating the **Language Model Node**.  
No need to modify any other logic or formatting.

---

### üß™ How to customize this workflow

- **Change the LLM** model from the Ollama node to OpenAI, etc.  
- Modify the final HTML layout in the **‚ÄúTurn to HTML‚Äù** node  
- Add a **PDF export**, **email delivery**, or **Google Drive sync**  
- Replace the chat trigger with a webform, CRM hook, etc.

---

### ‚úÖ Requirements

- A working LLM integration (Ollama or OpenAI recommended)
- n8n (self-hosted or cloud)

---

### üìå Notes

- Sticky notes included for setup and instructions  
- Each node clearly named by function (e.g. "Customer Segments Generator")  
- Designed for speed, structure, and professional presentation  

---

### üì© Need help?

For setup questions, custom features, or LLM integration support, contact:  
**sinamirshafiee@gmail.com**

parameters.initialMessages:
Hi there! üëã
Please tell me everything about your business, and I will help you create the business canvas.

parameters.text:
=Act as a strategic business analyst. Based on the idea and goals I give you, list 10 key insights for the "Key Partners" section of the Business Model Canvas. Be sure to cover the following questions:

- Who are our key partners?
- Who are our key suppliers?
- Which key resources are we acquiring from partners?
- Which key activities do our partners perform?
- Motivation for partnerships: Optimization, risk reduction, resource access

Format your answer as bullet points, separated by a pipe symbol. Write only the points without numbering or explanations or titling, just body bullet points, and each item of bullet points should be less than 10 words, preferably 4-5 words (each of the should be meaningfull.

the only acceptable output structure is like this:
point1 | point2 | point3 ...

do not include header or title 

This is the goal and idea of the project : 
{{ $json.chatInput }}

=Act as a strategic business analyst. Based on the business idea I gave you, generate 6-7 insights for the "Key Activities" section of the Business Model Canvas. Consider the following questions:

- What key activities do our value propositions require?
- What key activities are needed for our distribution channels?
- What activities support customer relationships?
- What activities support our revenue streams?

Also include examples based on activity type:
- Production
- Problem Solving
- Platform/Network

Format your answer as bullet points, separated by a pipe symbol. Write only the points without numbering or explanations or titling, just body bullet points, and each item of bullet points should be less than 10 words, preferably 4-5 words (each of the should be meaningfull.

the only acceptable output structure is like this:
point1 | point2 | point3 ...

do not include header or title, do not use any enter (\n)

This is the goal and idea of the project : 
{{ $json.chatInput }}

=You're a value-driven strategist. Based on the provided business idea, write 6-7 concise bullet points that define the "Value Proposition" section of the Business Model Canvas. Address these key questions:

- What value do we deliver to the customer?
- What customer problems are we solving?
- What bundles of products/services are we offering?
- What needs are we satisfying?

Use these attributes to shape your ideas:
- Newness, Performance, Customization, Job completion, Design, Brand/Status
- Price, Cost reduction, Risk reduction, Accessibility, Convenience

Format your answer as bullet points, separated by a pipe symbol. Write only the points without numbering or explanations or titling, just body bullet points, and each item of bullet points should be less than 10 words, preferably 4-5 words (each of the should be meaningfull.

the only acceptable output structure is like this:
point1 | point2 | point3 ...

do not include header or title, do not use any enter (\n)

This is the goal and idea of the project : 
{{ $json.chatInput }}

=As a customer relationship strategist, provide 6-7 key approaches for the "Customer Relationship" section of the Business Model Canvas, based on the business idea. Reflect on these questions:

- What type of relationship does each customer segment expect?
- What relationships have we already established?
- How are these relationships integrated with the rest of our business model?
- What is the cost of maintaining these relationships?

You may use formats like:
- Personal assistance, Self-service, Automated services, Communities, Co-creation

Format your answer as bullet points, separated by a pipe symbol. Write only the points without numbering or explanations or titling, just body bullet points, and each item of bullet points should be less than 10 words, preferably 4-5 words (each of the should be meaningfull.

the only acceptable output structure is like this:
point1 | point2 | point3 ...

do not include header or title, do not use any enter (\n)
This is the goal and idea of the project : 
{{ $json.chatInput }}

=Act as a segmentation expert. Based on the business idea provided, define 6-7 customer segments for the "Customer Segments" section of the Business Model Canvas. Make sure your suggestions address:

- For whom are we creating value?
- Who are our most important customers?

Incorporate examples like:
- Mass market, Niche market, Segmented, Diversified, Multi-sided platforms

Format your answer as bullet points, separated by a pipe symbol. Write only the points without numbering or explanations or titling, just body bullet points, and each item of bullet points should be less than 10 words, preferably 4-5 words (each of the should be meaningfull.

the only acceptable output structure is like this:
point1 | point2 | point3 ...

do not include header or title, do not use any enter (\n)

This is the goal and idea of the project : 
{{ $json.chatInput }}

=You're an operational strategist. Based on the business idea, generate 6-7 bullet points for the "Key Resources" section of the Business Model Canvas. Answer:

- What key resources does our value proposition require?
- What resources are needed for our distribution channels, customer relationships, revenue streams?

Consider:
- Physical, Intellectual (e.g. patents, data), Human, Financial

Format your answer as bullet points, separated by a pipe symbol. Write only the points without numbering or explanations or titling, just body bullet points, and each item of bullet points should be less than 10 words, preferably 4-5 words (each of the should be meaningfull.

the only acceptable output structure is like this:
point1 | point2 | point3 ...

do not include header or title 

This is the goal and idea of the project : 
{{ $json.chatInput }}

=You're a marketing strategist. Provide 6-7 channel strategies for the "Channels" section of the Business Model Canvas, using the business idea. Answer:

- Through which channels do customers want to be reached?
- How are we reaching them now?
- How are channels integrated?
- Which channels work best?
- Which are most cost-efficient?
- How are we integrating them with customer routines?

Format your answer as bullet points, separated by a pipe symbol. Write only the points without numbering or explanations or titling, just body bullet points, and each item of bullet points should be less than 10 words, preferably 4-5 words (each of the should be meaningfull.

the only acceptable output structure is like this:
point1 | point2 | point3 ...

do not include header or title, do not use any enter (\n)

This is the goal and idea of the project : 
{{ $json.chatInput }}

=You're a finance strategist. Based on the business idea, provide 6-7 main cost drivers for the "Cost Structure" section of the Business Model Canvas. Include insights related to:

- Most important costs in our business model
- Most expensive key resources
- Most expensive key activities




Format your answer as bullet points, separated by a pipe symbol. Write only the points without numbering or explanations or titling, just body bullet points, and each item of bullet points should be less than 10 words, preferably 4-5 words (each of the should be meaningfull.

the only acceptable output structure is like this:
point1 | point2 | point3 ...

do not include header or title, do not use any enter (\n)

This is the goal and idea of the project : 
{{ $json.chatInput }}

=Act as a monetization expert. Based on the business idea, generate 6-7 revenue strategies for the "Revenue Streams" section of the Business Model Canvas. Reflect on:

- What value are customers willing to pay for?
- What are they paying for now?
- How do they pay?
- How would they prefer to pay?
- What is the contribution of each stream?

Format your answer as bullet points, separated by a pipe symbol. Write only the points without numbering or explanations or titling, just body bullet points, and each item of bullet points should be less than 10 words, preferably 4-5 words (each of the should be meaningfull.

the only acceptable output structure is like this:
point1 | point2 | point3 ...

do not include header or title, do not use any enter (\n)
This is the goal and idea of the project : 
{{ $json.chatInput }}

parameters.content:
## üîÅ Changeable LLM Model

This template is powered by **Ollama LLM (LLaMA 3.1)** by default ‚Äî but it‚Äôs fully flexible.

You can easily swap in any other LLM (like OpenAI, Claude, etc.) by updating the AI Agent nodes. No changes are required in the logic or formatting nodes ‚Äî the system will work seamlessly.

## How to get the output? 

Once all nodes have finished processing, your complete Business Model Canvas will be available as a downloadable HTML file.

Simply navigate to the final node titled **‚ÄúHTML code to HTML file‚Äù** (at the end of the workflow). There, you‚Äôll see two options:

‚Ä¢ **View** : to preview the HTML output directly in your browser

‚Ä¢ **Download** : to save the file locally for printing or sharing

üëâ Click on the **‚ÄúDownload‚Äù** button to retrieve your fully generated canvas file.

## I'm here to help!

If you need assistance customizing the model or have feedback to share, please don‚Äôt hesitate to reach out. Your thoughts are important to me, and I'm eager to support you in any way I can. 

**üì© sinamirshafiee@gmail.com**

I‚Äôm new to n8n, but not new to building smart stuff that works.

If you see something weird in my templates or just want to chat, feel free to message me on LinkedIn or email me at sinamirshafiee@gmail.com.

Let‚Äôs automate some chaos!
